comments:
Log with exception below.

Scenario:
0. No user has opened container.
1. User_A opens container.
2. User_A closes container.

My assumption is - server tries to send container event, but it has already closed a topic, because there is no more users for the container.


==========
  LOG:
==========

[DEBUG] [2007.01.24 02:22:55 CET] [org.eclipse.corona.container.project.services]: exiting: closeContainer(String containerUri)
[DEBUG] [2007.01.24 02:22:55 CET] [org.eclipse.corona.container.project.services]: exiting: closeProjectContainerForMember(String containerUri, String memberId)
[WARN] [2007.01.24 02:22:55 CET] [org.eclipse.corona.container]: Unable to convert OSGi event into a ContextContainerEvent
[WARN] [2007.01.24 02:22:55 CET] [org.eclipse.corona.container]: ContextContainer does not exist for event
[ERROR] [2007.01.24 02:22:55 CET] [org.eclipse.corona.container]: Unable to create container event
java.lang.IllegalStateException: ContextContainer does not exist for event
	at org.eclipse.corona.container.event.ContextContainerEvent.<init>(ContextContainerEvent.java:132)
	at org.eclipse.corona.container.event.ContextContainerEventManager.handleEvent(ContextContainerEventManager.java:170)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.event.EventAdminImpl$EventAdminDispatcher.dispatchEvent(EventAdminImpl.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager.dispatchEvent(EventManager.java:189)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager$EventThread.run(EventManager.java:291)

Works as designed.

The ContextContainerEvent is being distributed to notify others that the ContextContainer is being closed.  Since the container is closed, the event is unable to find the container it is associated with.
OK, but if it is "as designed" we should print error message.
*** Bug 173270 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Could we add code to check if the action is "close" and NOT print the error message.  Because a close could be ignored if the container is gone.  However other actions event should produce the error.

Also could you put more information in the error.

traces.message: ContextContainer does not exist for event
